Title: Settings Management
Description: Configure application settings, themes, shortcuts, and user preferences.

Topics.Title: Theme Customization
Topics.Summary: Personalize the application appearance with themes.
Topics.Content:
Theme Customization

The application supports multiple visual themes to suit your preference and lighting conditions.

Available Themes

  • Default: Standard light theme with high contrast.
  • Dark: Dark mode for low-light environments to reduce eye strain.
  • Blue: Professional blue-tinted interface.
  • Forest: Calming green-tinted interface.

Changing Themes

  1. Navigate to the Settings tab.
  2. Select the Themes card.
  3. Choose your preferred theme from the dropdown menu.
  4. Click Save to apply changes immediately.

Note: Theme preferences are saved to your user profile and will persist across sessions.

Topics.Title: Shortcut Customization
Topics.Summary: Customize keyboard shortcuts for maximum productivity.
Topics.Content:
Shortcut Customization

You can modify keyboard shortcuts to match your workflow.

How to Customize

  1. Go to Settings > Shortcuts.
  2. Expand the category you wish to modify (e.g., Inventory, Navigation).
  3. Click the ... button next to the action you want to change.
  4. Press the new key combination in the dialog window.
  5. Click Save.

Conflict Resolution

The system will prevent you from assigning a shortcut that is already in use. If a conflict occurs, you must first reassign or clear the existing shortcut.

Resetting Defaults

To restore all shortcuts to their original system defaults, click the Reset to Defaults button at the bottom of the Shortcuts panel.

Topics.Title: General Preferences
Topics.Content:
General Preferences

Manage core application settings.

  • Animations: Toggle UI animations for smoother transitions or faster performance.
  • Font Size: Adjust the base font size for better readability.
  • Grid Settings: Column visibility and order for data grids are automatically saved when you modify them via the right-click context menu on grid headers.
